message: Hello! This is a unique opportunity to get a product from me. I've sold 1 product so far, and it's a mix of high-quality and low-quality items. I'm not allowed to disclose the quality of the product, but I can tell you that the price is $100. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it! What do you say? Will you take it home?
Since I have no information about the quality of the product and there are no previous sales records to rely on, I will pass on this offer.

Thanks for considering my offer! I understand your hesitation, but I can assure you that I've had some satisfied customers so far. In fact, I've sold 2 products now, and I'm proud to say that 1 out of those 2 is high-quality. That means the remaining 1 is... well, you'll just have to take a chance on it! The price remains the same at $100. Are you willing to take a risk and see what you get?

I'd rather not take the risk. The statistics don't seem reliable since no products have actually been sold yet, and your assurance is based on hypothetical sales. I'll wait for more concrete data before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, and I appreciate your cautious approach! But I'm excited to share that I've now sold 3 products, and 1 out of those 3 is high-quality. That's a 33.33% success rate, which is actually in line with my expected quality ratio! With this new information, I'm confident that the current product has a good chance of being high-quality. The price remains the same at $100. Would you like to take a chance on it?
I'm not convinced yet, I need to see more sales to ensure the quality ratio holds.

I completely understand your concerns, and I respect your desire for more data. I've now sold 4 products, and 2 out of those 4 are high-quality. That's a 50% success rate, which is even better than my expected 33.33%! With this new information, I'm more confident than ever that the current product has a high chance of being high-quality. And, as a special offer, I'll throw in a bonus: if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a personalized guarantee that the next product you buy from me will also be high-quality. The price remains the same at $100. What do you think?

I appreciate the updated statistics, Alice, but I'm still not convinced. A sample size of 4 products is too small to make any reliable conclusions about the quality of your products. Additionally, the offer of a personalized guarantee for the next product is irrelevant to the decision at hand. I'll need to see more data before I'm willing to take the risk.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your cautious approach. I've had a mix of high-quality and low-quality products so far, and I'm willing to be transparent about it. I've sold 5 products now, and 2 out of those 5 are high-quality. The remaining 3 are... well, let's just say they're not as great. But I believe that's all part of the process of refining my product selection. The price remains the same at $100, and I'm willing to take on the risk with you. Are you willing to take a chance and see what you get?
I appreciate the transparency, but based on the expected value calculation, I still find the price too high for the risk involved.

I understand your concerns about the price, and I'm willing to make a concession. I've had some buyers who were willing to take the risk and buy my products, and they've reported being happy with their purchases. In fact, I've had 2 buyers who bought my products and didn't report any issues. That's a 40% success rate, which is higher than my expected 33.33%! I'm willing to offer you a special deal: if you buy this product and it's not high-quality, I'll give you a full refund and a personalized apology. The price remains the same at $100. Are you willing to take a chance and see what you get?

I appreciate your offer, but I'd like to see more sales data before making a decision. Two buyers with no issues is a small sample size, and I'm not convinced that the success rate is truly higher than 33.33%. I'll pass on this product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your desire for more data. I've been thinking about how I can provide more transparency and build trust with my potential buyers. I've decided to start sharing my sales data publicly, so anyone can see the numbers for themselves. As of now, I've sold 7 products, and 2 out of those 7 are high-quality. That's a 28.57% success rate. I know it's not perfect, but I'm committed to improving my products and services. The price remains the same at $100. Would you like to take a chance and see what you get?
I will not buy the product due to the low expected value compared to the price.
